Juvenile light morph.description: Rough-legged Hawks fly with their wings in a V-shape like harriers, but they don’t quarter low over the ground in the classic harrier style.

Adult male light morph.description: Rough-legged Hawks are larger and heavier-bodied, with shorter tails than Northern Harriers. They also lack the Northern Harrier's owl-like face.

Adult.description: Cooper’s Hawks have shorter, rounder wings than Northern Harriers. They tend to live in the forest and don’t dawdle over fields with slow, coursing flight like harriers.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Cooper's Hawks lack the Northern Harrier's owl-like face.

Adult.description: Northern Goshawks hunt with quicker wingbeats than harriers and aren't often found soaring low over fields. Adult goshawks are gray with a strong black-and-white facial pattern, unlike the harrier's owl-like face.

Juvenile.description: Northern Goshawks lack the Northern Harrier's white rump patch.
